Title: Mac OS X Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A specially crafted AFP server can trigger code execution with system privileges in the AFP client [CVE-2009-2819].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A document containing a specially crafted embedded font can trigger a buffer overflow in Apple Type Services and cause code execution [CVE-2009-2824].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A specially crafted PDF file can trigger an integer overflow in CoreGraphics and cause code execution [CVE-2009-2826].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A remote user can trigger a memory corruption error in DirectoryService and execute arbitrary code on systems configured as DirectoryService servers [CVE-2009-2828].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A specially crafted disk image containing a FAT filesystem can trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-2827].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A specially crafted Common Document Format (CDF) file can, when run via the file command, trigger a buffer overflow in file and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-2830].  Systems prior to version 10.6 are not affected.

A remote authenticated user can issue a specially crafted CWD command to execute arbitrary code on the target FTP Server [CVE-2009-2832].  Only Mac OS X Server systems are affected.

A user on the local network can return specially crafted 'help:runscript' links to the connected Help Viewer to cause code execution on the target Help Viewer [CVE-2009-2808].  Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted TIFF image can trigger a buffer underflow and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-2285].

An application using the UCCompareTextDefault API can trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2009-2833].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.  Nikita Zhuk and Petteri Kamppuri of MK&C reported this vulnerability.

A user may launch unsafe content that does not trigger a user warning [CVE-2009-2810].  Systems prior to version 10.6 are not affected.

A specially crafted PICT image can trigger a heap overflow and cause code execution in QuickDraw Manager [CVE-2009-2837].  Nicolas Joly of VUPEN Vulnerability Research Team reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted Microsoft Office file can trigger an integer overflow in QuickLook and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-2838].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A specially crafted VNC server can trigger a memory corruption flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2009-2839].  Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2009-006 / Mac OS X v10.6.2, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Security Update 2009-006 or Mac OS X v10.6.2.

For Mac OS X v10.6.1
The download file is named: MacOSXUpd10.6.2.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: f222714b67a8a982f6d11df51987dd09a448130d

For Mac OS X v10.6
The download file is named: MacOSXUpdCombo10.6.2.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: adbe2e8a81e227c1903dd049b6a3ea5f60b6ea49

For Mac OS X Server v10.6.1
The download file is named: MacOSXServerUpd10.6.2.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: 06ba39076d1f56d216e1dafde7b9e7c93fdcd4dc

For Mac OS X Server v10.6
The download file is named: MacOSXServerUpdCombo10.6.2.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: ff61766cb34e82a5aa2d813392511c00231de684

For Mac OS X v10.5.8
The download file is named: SecUpd2009-006.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: 8eb0c42c84cf8eebe025d64114dbc861a99a67b0

For Mac OS X Server v10.5.8
The download file is named: SecUpdSrvr2009-006.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: b8570d8c678b68ea5d9163af5232a91d8670cf5c

Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:

A local user can exploit a flaw in the Stream Control Transmission Protocol (sctp(7P)) and Sockets Direct Protocol driver (sdp(7D)) to trigger a kernel memory leak, leading to denial of service conditions on the target system.
Impact': A local user can consume kernel memory on the target system.

The vendor has issued a fix.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A remote user can modify the configuration on the target system.
A remote user can access the PowerHA Cluster Management port (port 6177) and make arbitrary modifications to the local AIX configuration.
Impact': A remote user can modify the operating system configuration on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following APARs (with availability date listed):

Title: Solaris Trusted Extensions May Prevent XScreenSaver Screen From Locking
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris Trusted Extensions.  The XScreenSaver screen lock mail fail to engage.
The screen may fail to lock if the target user chooses to lock the screen from the JDS menu or if the screen is left unattended.
Impact': A physically local user may be able to access the system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: Solaris Sockets Direct Protocol Driver Flaw Lets Remote and Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote or local user can exploit a flaw in the Solaris Sockets Direct Protocol (SDP) driver (sdp(7D)) to consume all available kernel memory.

No applications bundled with Solaris are affected.  However, third-party applications that make use of the SDP driver may be affected.
Impact': A remote or user can consume all available kernel memory on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_95 or later

Title: OpenBSD getsockopt(2) Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke the getsockopt(2) call with certain options (e.g., IP_AUTH_LEVEL, IP_ESP_TRANS_LEVEL, IP_ESP_NETWORK_LEVEL, IP_IPCOMP_LEVEL) to cause the target system to crash.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.

Title: Solaris Trusted Extensions Weakness May Let Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user with access to the X server may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote user with access to the target X server can exploit a flaw in the Solaris Trusted Extensions Policy configuration and then leverage an additional vulnerability to gain privileges on the target server.
Impact': A remote user with access to the X server may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_126 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 126364-08 or later

Title: Solaris ZFS Filesystem Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with the 'file_chown_self' privilege can exploit a flaw in the ZFS filesystem to take ownership of the root of the ZFS filesystem.  A local user may be able to exploit this to obtain elevated privileges.

Systems with patches 137137-09 (SPARC) or 137138-09 (x86) installed are affected.

Michael Myers reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user with the 'file_chown_self' privilege can obtain ownership of files on the target ZFS filesystem.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 141444-09 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_118 or later

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_118 or later

Title: (Sun Issues Fix for OpenSolaris) Xpdf Buffer Overflows and Memory Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Xpdf.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  OpenSolaris GNOME PDF Viewer is affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will trigger a buffer overflow or memory free error in the JBIG2 decoder and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user or application.

Integer overflows can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-0147, CVE-2009-1179].

Buffer overflows can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-0146, CVE-2009-1182].

Several flaws may cause arbitrary memory to be incorrectly freed, executing arbitrary code [CVE-2009-0166, CVE-2009-1180].

Input validation flaws can trigger code execution [CVE-2009-0800].

Will Dormann of the CERT/CC created the JBIG2 decoder testsuite that was used to discover these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix for OpenSolaris for CVE-2009-0146, CVE-2009-0147, and CVE-2009-0166.

SPARC Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_114 or later

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_114 or later

The Sun advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-269008-1

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the IBM AIX calendar daemon.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the calendar daemon ('rpc.cmsd') to trigger a buffer overflow in the calendar daemon library ('libcsa.a') and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with root privileges.

Rodrigo Rubira Branco and iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.

Title: Palm webOS JavaScript Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users Access Files on the Target Device
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Palm webOS.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can supply specially crafted JavaScript that, when loaded by the target user, will access files on target user's system.  The vulnerability can be exploited via e-mail.

Demonstration exploit code is available (in an image) at:

http://tlhsecurity.com/advisories/FA_Code.jpg

The original advisory is available at:

http://tlhsecurity.blogspot.com/2009/10/palm-pre-webos-11-remote-file-access.html

Townsend Ladd Harris reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:

http://kb.palm.com/wps/portal/kb/na/pre/p100eww/sprint/solutions/article/50607_en.html#121

Title: OpenBSD Kernel XMM Exception Handling Error Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the OpenBSD Kernel.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger an XMM exception to cause a kernel panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued patches:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.4/i386/015_xmm.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.5/i386/008_xmm.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.6/i386/002_xmm.patch

Title: FreeBSD devfs/VFS Race Condition Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a race condition between the device file system (devfs) and the virtual file system (VFS) to trigger a null pointer dereference and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Przemyslaw Frasunek reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and has provided the following solution instructions [quoted].

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_7_2, RELENG_7_1, RELENG_6_4, or RELENG_6_3 security branch
dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3, 6.4,
7.1, and 7.2 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 6.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:14/devfs6.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:14/devfs6.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 7.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:14/devfs7.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:14/devfs7.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-09:14.devfs.asc

Title: FreeBSD kqueue Pipe Race Condition Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a race condition in the kqueue event management API code to trigger a use-after-free memory error.  This may result in a null pointer dereference and arbitrary code execution.

Przemyslaw Frasunek reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or to the RELENG_6_4, or
RELENG_6_3 security branch dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3 and 6.4.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:13/pipe.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:13/pipe.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-09:13.pipe.asc

Title: Solaris Bug in Solaris IP(7P) Module and STREAMS Framework Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger memory leaks in the Solaris IP(7P) module and STREAMS Framework to cause the target system to hang.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 122300-44 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 141414-09 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_109 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-44 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 141415-09 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_109 or later

Sun is working on a fix for Solaris 8.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-263388-1

Title: IBM AIX NFSv4 Bugs Let Remote and Local Users Access NFSv4 Shares
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in IBM AIX.  A local or remote user can access NFSv4 shares.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the handling of the NFSv4 Kerberos credential cache to access Kerberized AIX NFSv4 shares.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the nfs_portmon tunable to access AIX NFSv4 shares ostensibly protected by the nfs_portmon tunable.

The following commands are vulnerable:

/usr/sbin/gssd
/usr/lib/drivers/nfs.ext

Anton Lundin reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local or remote user can access NFSv4 shares.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APAR IZ50496, IZ50444, IZ50399, IZ49278, IZ49096, IZ49024).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ50496
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ50444
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ50399
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ49278
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ49096
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ49024
http://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/nfs4_advisory.asc

Title: Solaris DMI Service Provider Resource Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris DMI Service Provider.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted requests to the DMI Service Provider (dmispd) to cause excessive CPU and memory consumption on the target system for a temporary period of time.

Jeremy Brown reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive CPU and memory consumption on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Solaris Trusted Extensions Common Desktop Environment Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris Trusted Extensions Common Desktop Environment.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in Solaris Trusted Extensions Common Desktop Environment (CDE) to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges or bypass Mandatory Access Control (MAC) policy.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system or bypass MAC policy.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch patch 126365-15 and 139620-01 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch patch 126366-15 and 139621-01 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-267488-1

Title: Solaris Cluster Configuration Utility  Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris Cluster Configuration Utility.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Solaris Cluster configuration utility (clsetup(1CL)) to gain elevated privileges and potentially execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

Version 3.2 of the utility is affected.

Martin Carpenter from Citco (www.citco.com) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris Cluster 3.2 (for Solaris 9) with patch 126105-34 or later
    * Solaris Cluster 3.2 (for Solaris 10) with patch 126106-34 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris Cluster 3.2 (for Solaris 10) with patch 126107-34 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-267148-1

Title: HP-UX Role-Based Access Control Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX Role-Based Access Control (RBAC).  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Systems running RBAC are affected.

Logica UK Limited reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

B.11.23 (11i v2):  AccessControl_B.11.23.06_HP-UX_B.11.23_IA+PA.depot

B.11.31 (11i v3):  PHCO_40131

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01866178

Title: Solaris iSCSI Management Commands Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user that has been assigned an RBAC execution profile which specifies additional privileges for the iscsiadm(1M) or iscsitadm(1M) commands (e.g., the "File System Management" profile) can execute arbitrary commands with the privileges specified in the RBAC profile.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system in certain configurations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 119090-33 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_110 or later

x86 Platform

Title: NetBSD Pre-Commit Failure Processing Flaw May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD.  A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger an iret instruction failure to potentially cause the kernel stack to become desynchronized.  This may allow the local user to gain elevated privileges.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.cr0.org/misc/CVE-2009-2793.txt

Tavis Ormandy and Julien Tinnes of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX bootpd.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can cause the target system to become unavailable.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

B.11.23 (11i v2): PHNE_39668 or subsequent

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a heap overflow in the w(1) utility to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

Monarch Rich reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: Mac OS X Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Access Files on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.  A remote user can access files on the target system.
Mac OS X v10.6 is not affected.

A specially crafted alias file can trigger a buffer overflow in the Alias Manager [CVE-2009-2800].

A specially crafted resource fork can trigger a memory corruption error in CarbonCore [CVE-2009-2803].

An image with a specially crafted embedded ColorSync profile can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-2804].

A PDF file with a specially crafted JBIG2 stream can trigger an integer overflow in CoreGraphics [CVE-2009-2805].  Will Dormann of CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted web page can trigger a heap overflow in CoreGraphics in the rendering of long strings [CVE-2009-2468].  Will Drewry of Google reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted PixarFilm-encoded TIFF image can trigger a memory corruption error in ImageIO [CVE-2009-2809].

A remote user can create a '.fileloc' file that, when downloaded by the target user, will not display a warning to the target user [CVE-2009-2811].

Specially crafted HTML may cause Launch Services to open an unsafe exported documnt type [CVE-2009-2812].  Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

Systems with Windows File Sharing enabled may share folders unexpectedly [CVE-2009-2813].  Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.  J. David Hester of LCG Systems National Institutes of Health reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request containing non-UTF-8 encoded data to the Wiki Server to trigger a cross-site scripting vulnerability [CVE-2009-2814].  Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file or resource that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.

A remote user can access files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2009-005), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: (Sun Issues Advisory) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Multiple vendors and products are affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Sun Solaris is affected.  Sun is working on a fix.

The Sun advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-267088-1

Title: Solaris lx Branded Zones Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user on a Solaris x86 Intel-based system running in 64-bit mode can exploit a flaw in lx branded zones to cause a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 141415-10 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_118 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-266228-1

Title: Solaris sockfs HTTP Request Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris sockfs.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to exploit a flaw in the sockfs kernel module and trigger a system panic.

Systems configured as an HTTP server with the Solaris Network Cache Accelerator (nca(1)) and with logging enabled are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause a system panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 141690-02 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 141691-02 or later

Sun is working on a fix for OpenSolaris.

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-265888-1

Title: Solaris Print Service Lets Remote and Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris Print Service.  A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote or local user can exploit a flaw in in.lpd(1M) to cause the target system to slow down and become unresponsive.
Impact': A remote or local user can cause the target system to become unresponsive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

    * Solaris 9 with patch 113329-07 or later

Description:

A local user can trigger a system panic.

Jason Hoos reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic.

Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke sendfile(3EXT) and sendfilev(3EXT) to make specially crafted vnode function calls and cause a system panic.

Title: Solaris Kernel Memory Mapping Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a flaw in the interaction of the filesystem and virtual memory subsystems to create file deadlocks and cause the system to slow down and eventually stop operating.

Title: Mac OS X Multiple Image and File Processing Bugs Permit Remote Code Execution
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted image or file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A specially crafted image with an embedded ColorSync profile can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2009-1726].  Chris Evans of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted Canon RAW image can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2009-1728].  Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted OpenEXR image can trigger a heap overflow in ImageIO [CVE-2009-1722].  Lurene Grenier of Sourcefire VRT and Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted OpenEXR image can trigger an uninitialized memory access error in ImageIO [CVE-2009-1721].

A specially crafted OpenEXR image can trigger an integer overflow in ImageIO [CVE-2009-1720].

An image with specially crafted EXIF metadata can trigger a buffer overflow in ImageIO [CVE-2009-2188].  Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

A remote user can return a specially crafted AppleTalk response packet to trigger a buffer overflow in the kernel [CVE-2009-2193].  Ilja van Sprundel from IOActive reported this vulnerability.

Specially crafted XML content can trigger a buffer overflow in the Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) library used by XQuery in the processing of character classes in regular expressions [CVE-2008-0674].
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2009-003 / Mac OS X v10.5.8), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies
to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either
Security Update 2009-003 or Mac OS X v10.5.8.

Mac OS X v10.4 systems, CVE-2009-1728 was corrected in Digital Camera RAW Compatibility Update 2.6.

Title: Mac OS X Networking Bugs Let Remote and Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X.  A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can open a large number of connections to an inetd-based launchd service to cause launchd to stop processing incoming connections to the target service [CVE-2009-2190].  The system must be restarted to return to normal operations.

A local user can send messages containing file descriptors to a socket that has no receiver to cause the target system to shutdown [CVE-2009-2194].  Bennet Yee of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause launchd to stop processing connections for the target service.

A local user can cause the target system to shutdown.

Title: Mac OS X Kernel fcntl() Implementation Flaws Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges

Title: IBM AIX ibC _LIB_INIT_DBG File Creation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can set specially crafted _LIB_INIT_DBG and _LIB_INIT_DBG_FILE environment variables to cause a debugging component of the XL C++ runtime library to create arbitrary, root-owned, world writable files.  This can be exploited to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

Demonstration exploit code is available at:

http://milw0rm.com/exploits/9645

Karol Wiesek and iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

Description:

The user can set a specially crafted PATH environment variable value to trigger a stack overflow in the gethdate() function.

The user can set a specially crafted GENOCIDED environment variable value to trigger a buffer overflow in the main() function when in wizard mode.

The pam_unix authentication module allows a local non-root user with knowledge of the root password to invoke passwd(1) and change the password.

Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can supply specially crafted XML data to a driver that uses proplib to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause a kernel panic.

A non-defined element (e.g., "<number>") in the external XML form can trigger this flaw.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
NetBSD has issued a fix (4.0.2, 4.1, 5.0).

The NetBSD advisory is available at:

http://ftp.netbsd.org/pub/NetBSD/security/advisories/NetBSD-SA2009-003.txt.asc

Title: FreeBSD SIOCSIFINFO_IN6 IOCTL Access Bug Lets Local Users Modify IPv6 Interface Properties
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD kernel.  A local user can modify IPv6 interface settings.
The SIOCSIFINFO_IN6 ioctl does not properly check user permissions.  A local user can modify IPv6 interface properties, including changing the link MTU and disabling the interface.

IPv4 is not affected.

Hiroki Sato reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can modify interface properties, including disabling the interface.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and has provided the following solution instructions [quoted].

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_7_2, RELENG_7_1, RELENG_6_4, or RELENG_6_3 security branch
dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3, 6.4,
7.1, and 7.2 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 6.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:10/ipv6-6.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:10/ipv6-6.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 7.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:10/ipv6.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:10/ipv6.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-09:10.ipv6.asc

Title: FreeBSD Kernel Integer Overflow in Pipe Implementation Lets Local Users Read System Memory

A local user can trigger an integer overflow in the pipe implementation to read pages of memory of other processes or of the kernel.

Pieter de Boer reported this vulnerability.

Solution:

RELENG_7_2, RELENG_7_1, RELENG_6_4, or RELENG_6_3 security branch
dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3, 6.4,
7.1, and 7.2 systems.

detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-09:09.pipe.asc

Title: Apple Terminal Integer Overflow in Window Resizing Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in Apple Terminal.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML (referencing xterm) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow in Apple Terminal and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The vulnerability resides in the processing of 'CSI[4' xterm window resizing escape code.

The vendor was notified on May 6, 2009.

Rob King, TippingPoint DVLabs, reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://dvlabs.tippingpoint.com/advisory/TPTI-09-04
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued a fix as part of Security Update 2009-002 / Mac OS X v10.5.7, described at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3549

[Editor's note:  The vendor's advisory does not reference this CVE number.]

Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in sadmind.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root level privileges.

Specially crafted RPC request parameters can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2008-3869].

Specially crafted 'sadmind' requests sent via RPC can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-3870].

The vendor was notified on October 30, 2008 and October 31, 2008.

Alin Rad Pop of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user with access to the memory card device can exploit a flaw in the Solaris Secure Digital Slot Driver (sdhost(7D)) to corrupt portions of kernel memory or execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix:

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon build snv_109 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-259408-1

Title: IBM AIX libc MALLOCDEBUG File Overwrite Bug Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a race condition in the MALLOCDEBUG debugging component of the malloc subsystem in the 'libc.a' library to overwrite arbitrary files on the target system.

The following libraries are affected:

/usr/ccs/lib/libc.a
/usr/ccs/lib/libp/libc.a

iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following APARs (with availability date):

5.3.0 IZ50500 07/01/09
5.3.7 IZ50517 07/01/09
5.3.8 IZ50447 07/01/09
5.3.9 IZ50445 07/01/09
6.1.0 IZ50139 06/03/09
6.1.1 IZ50129 06/03/09
6.1.2 IZ50121 06/03/09

The APARs are available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ50500
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ50517

Title: Solaris fstat() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a flaw in the fstat(2) system call to trigger a system panic.  A file descriptor of 'AT_FDCWD' can trigger the flaw.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 122300-40 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-40 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-257988-1

Title: Mac OS X CFF Font and Cscope Source File Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a document containing specially crafted Compact Font Format (CFF) fonts that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in Apple Type Services and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-0154].  Charlie Miller of Independent Security Evaluators reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.

A remote user can create a specially crafted source file that, when viewed by the target user with Cscope, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-0148].
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APPLE-SA-2009-05-12 Security Update 2009-002; and Mac OS X 10.5.7), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Mac OS X Disk Image Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A specially crafted sparse disk image can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2009-0150].  Systems prior to OS X 10.5 are not affected.  Tiller Beauchamp of IOActive reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted sparse disk image can trigger memory corruption flaws [CVE-2009-0149].
Impact': A remote user can create a disk image that, when mounted by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Mac OS X Help Viewer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Help Viewer.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted 'help:' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will run arbitrary scripting code, which may permit arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.

A specially crafted 'help:' URL may reference an external Cascading Style Sheet that is not within a registered help book and execute arbitrary AppleScript files [CVE-2009-0942].

A specially crafted 'help:' URL may reference an HTML document that is not within a registered help book and execute arbitrary AppleScript files [CVE-2009-0943].

Brian Mastenbrook reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create a 'help:' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APPLE-SA-2009-05-12 Security Update 2009-002; and Mac OS X 10.5.7), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Finder and Spotlight Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X in the Launch Services and Spotlight components.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when downloaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system or trigger a memory access error and cause denial of service conditions.

A specially crafted Mach-O executable file may cause Finder to crash and reload repeatedly [CVE-2009-0156].

A specially crafted Microsoft Office file may cause the Microsoft Office Spotlight Importer to crash or cause arbitrary code to be executed [CVE-2009-0944].
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when downloaded by the target user, will cause the target application to crash or execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Mac OS X CFNetwork May Send Secure Cookies Over Non-encrypted Connections
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the CFNetwork component.  A remote user may be able to obtain secure cookies.
CFNetwork does not properly parse the HTTP Set-Cookie header.  As a result, applications that use CFNetwork (e.g., Safari) may incorrectly send cookies over non-encrypted connections.  A remote user monitoring the network between the client and the server may be able to obtain ostensibly secure cookies.

Systems prior to Mac OS X 10.5 are not affected.

Andrew Mortensen of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user monitoring the network between the client and server may be able to obtain secure cookies.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APPLE-SA-2009-05-12 Security Update 2009-002; and Mac OS X 10.5.7), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Kernel Workqueue Index Bug Lets Local Users Gain System Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X kernel.  A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the kernel's processing of workqueues to cause the target system to shutdown or to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with system privileges.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X CFNetwork Heap Overflow in Processing HTTP Headers Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the CFNetwork component.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote web server can return specially crafted HTTP headers to trigger a heap overflow in CFNetwork and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.5 are not affected.

Moritz Jodeit of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for OS X) FreeBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD kernel's IPv6 stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Mac OS X is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.

Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.

Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix (APPLE-SA-2009-05-12 Security Update 2009-002; and Mac OS X 10.5.7), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Bugs in CoreGraphics and QuickDraw Manager Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X in the CoreGraphics and QuickDraw Manager components.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF or PICT file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A specially crafted PDF file can trigger a memory corruption error in CoreGraphics [CVE-2009-0145].

A specially crafted PDF file can trigger an integer overflow in CoreGraphics [CVE-2009-0155].  Systems prior to Mac OS X version 10.5 are not affected.  Barry K. Nathan reported this vulnerability.

A specially crafted PICT image can trigger a memory corruption error in QuickDraw Manager [CVE-2009-0160].

A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an integer overflow in QuickDraw Manager [CVE-2009-0010].  Damian Put and Sebastian Apelt reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.  Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services also reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APPLE-SA-2009-05-12 Security Update 2009-002; and Mac OS X 10.5.7), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies
to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either
Security Update 2009-002 or Mac OS X v10.5.7.

Title: Solaris DTrace ioctl Hanlder Flaws Let Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit flaws in the Solaris DTrace (dtrace(1M)) ioctl(2) handlers to trigger a system panic.

Neil Kettle reported this vulnerability.

Some demonstration exploit code from mu-b from Digit-Labs is available at:

http://www.digit-labs.org/files/exploits/solaris-dtrace-dos.c
http://www.digit-labs.org/files/exploits/solaris-fasttrap-dos.c
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

SPARC Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_114 or later

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_114 or later

Sun is working on a fix for Solaris 10.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-257708-1

Title: HP-UX Bug in 'useradd' Command Lets Local Users Gain Access to Files and Directories
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX.  A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the useradd(1M) command to gain unauthorized access to files and directories on the target system.
Impact': A local user can gain unauthorized access to files and directories on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued patches.

B.11.11 (11i v1)  PHCO_38492 or subsequent
B.11.23 (11i v2)  PHCO_38491 or subsequent
B.11.31 (11i v3)  PHCO_38547 or subsequent

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01539431

Title: OpenSolaris SCTP Socket Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSolaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_108 or later


x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_108 or later

Title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in muxatmd Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the muxatmd command to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.

The vendor was notified on December 16, 2008.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following APARs (with availability dates listed):

5.3.0 IZ48496 07/01/2009
5.3.7 IZ48499 07/01/2009
5.3.8 IZ48500 07/01/2009
5.3.9 IZ48501 07/01/2009
6.1.0 IZ48502 06/03/2009
6.1.1 IZ48561 06/03/2009
6.1.2 IZ48562 06/03/2009

http://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/muxatmd_advisory.asc

Title: Solaris dircmp Script Lets Local Users Overwrite Arbitrary Files to Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris dircmp.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a temporary file race condition in the '/usr/bin/dircmp' command to overwrite or create arbitrary files on the target system with the privileges of the user calling dircmp(1).

River Tarnell of the Wikimedia Foundation reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 140837-01 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138896-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 141014-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_112 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 140838-01 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138897-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 141015-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_112 or later

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-253468-1

Title: Solaris 'mdb' Process Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user in a non-global zone can exploit an unspecified flaw to execute arbitrary code within a global zone when an mdb process in the global zone attaches to a process in the non-global zone.  The code will run with the privileges of the user running the mdb process, which may be root privileges.
Impact': A local user in a non-global zone can execute arbitrary code within a global zone, potentially with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_102 or later

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_102 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-255608-1

Title: HP-UX VERITAS File System and VERITAS Oracle Disk Manager Bug Lets Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in VERITAS File System and VERITAS Oracle Disk Manager on HP-UX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw with HP-UX running VERITAS File System (VRTSvxfs) or VERITAS Oracle Disk Manager (VRTSodm) to obtain elevated privileges.  No details were provided.

VRTSvxfs and VRTSodm are bundled with Storage Management Suite (SMS) and Storage Management for Oracle (SMO).

The following versions are affected:

HP-UX B.11.11 running VRTSodm 3.5
HP-UX B.11.23 running VRTSodm 4.1 or VRTSvxfs 4.1 or both
HP-UX B.11.23 running VRTSodm 5.0 or VRTSvxfs 5.0 or both
HP-UX B.11.31 running VRTSodm 5.0
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

B.11.11, VRTSvxfs 3.5: PHCO_39124

B.11.23 (IA and PA), VRTSvxfs 4.1, VRTSodm 4.1: PHCO_39027, PHKL_39029

B.11.23 (IA and PA), VRTSvxfs 5.0, VRTSodm 5.0: PHCO_39103, PHCO_39104, PHKL_38795

B.11.31, VRTSodm 5.0: PHKL_39130

B.11.31, VRTSvxfs 5.0: PHCO_38913, PHCO_39132

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01674733

Title: FreeBSD ktimer Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD ktimer.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted integer value to ktimer to overwrite arbitrary kernel memory locations.  This can be exploited to change the user ID of the process to an arbitrary user ID, escape from a jail, or bypass other security restrictions.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has provided the following solution instructions [quoted]:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 7-STABLE, or to the RELENG_7_1
or RELENG_7_0 security branch dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patch has been verified to apply to FreeBSD 7.0 and 7.1
systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:06/ktimer.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-09:06/ktimer.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-09:06.ktimer.asc

Title: Solaris ufs_getpage() and ufs_putpage() Bugs Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger flaws in the ufs_getpage() and ufs_putpage() functions to cause the system to hang or cause a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to hang or panic.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fixes.

CR 6442712

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_45 or later

CR 6425723 

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139483-05 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_86 or later

CR 6679732

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_92 or later

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-254628-1

Title: Solaris Keysock Kernel Module Bug Lets Certain Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user with certain privileges can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user with privileges to create PF_KEY sockets can exploit a flaw in the keysock kernel module keysock_get_opt() function to cause a system panic.
Impact': A local user with privileges to create PF_KEY sockets can cause a system panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 141008-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_109 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 141009-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_109 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-253568-1

Title: Solaris Doors Subsystem Flaws Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Solaris in the Doors subsystem.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can cause arbitrary door server processes on the target system to hang.

A local user in a non-global zone can can access files without having proper permissions and may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.
Impact':
A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause arbitrary door server processes on the target system to hang.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

These issues are addressed in the following releases:

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117350-61 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122300-37 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 137137-05 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_94 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117351-61 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-37 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 137138-05 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_94 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-242486-1

Title: Solaris NFS Server nfssec() Bug Lets Remote Users Access Shared Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris NFS server.  A remote user can access resources on the target system.
If a filesystem is shared with a combination of the "none" (AUTH_NONE) and "sys" (AUTH_SYS) security modes, a remote user can exploit a flaw in nfssec(5) to view shared resources on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can access resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139462-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_111 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139463-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_111 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-253588-1

Title: Solaris NFS Server Access List Bug Lets Remote Users Access Shared Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris NFS server.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in nfsd(1M) in the processing of security mode access list entries to view shared files on the target system.

Daniel Van Derveer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139462-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_106 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139463-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_106 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-250306-1

Title: Solaris NFSv4 Server Kernel Module Infinite Loop Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
On an NFSv4 server that is sharing an hsfs(7FS) file system (e.g., CD-ROM, DVD media), a local user can exploit a flaw in the NFSv4 Server kernel module rfs4_op_readdir() function to cause the NFSv4 server to enter an infinite loop.
Impact': A local user can cause the target NFSv4 server to hang.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139462-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_111 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139463-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_111 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-252469-1

Title: OpenBSD libc fts Function Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can make a call to one of the "fts" functions with a specially crafted (and deep) directory path to trigger a memory error and cause the system to crash.

The vulnerability resides in 'libc/gen/fts.c'.

The following applications can be used to trigger a crash:

du
rm
chmod -R
chgrp -R

Maksymilian Arciemowicz of SecurityReason.com reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/60
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available at:

http://www.openbsd.org/cgi-bin/cvsweb/src/lib/libc/gen/fts.c

Title: Solaris Crypto Driver Memory Free Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Solaris crypto pseudo device driver to cause a memory free error, resulting in a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139498-04 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_103 or later

x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139499-04 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_103 or later

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-254088-1

Title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in 'pppdial' May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted input string that is longer than 4000 characters to trigger a buffer overflow in 'pppdial' and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APARS IZ44199, IZ44220, IZ44332, IZ44388).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ44199

Title: OpenBSD bgpd Autonomous System Path Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD bgpd.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Autonomous System path value to cause the target bgpd(8) service to terminate.

The vulnerability resides in the aspath_prepend() function in 'usr.sbin/bgpd/rde_attr.c'.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target bgpd daemon to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following patches:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.4/common/010_bgpd.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.3/common/010_bgpd.patch

Title: Mac OS X SMB File Server Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target SMB file server to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target service to crash [CVE-2009-0139].  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.  Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

A remote user can connect to a target SMB file server to trigger a memory exhaustion error in the processing of file system names and cause the system to shutdown [CVE-2009-0140].
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X Remote Apple Events Server Memory Access Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service or Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Remote Apple Events.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory.
A remote user can send specially crafted Remote Apple events to obtain information from an uninitialized buffer on the target server [CVE-2009-0018] or from system memory [CVE-2009-0019].  The later flaw may also cause the target server to crash.

Title: Mac OS X csregprinter Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain System Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X csregprinter.  A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a heap overflow in csregprinter to execute arbitrary code on the target system with system privileges.

Lars Haulin reported this vulnerability.

Title: Mac OS X FSEvents Framework Bug Discloses Filesystem Activity to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X FSEvents Framework.  A local user can view limited filesystem information.
A local user can invoke fseventsd and exploit a credential management flaw to view certain filesystem activity, such as directory names and activity in the directory.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

Mark Dalrymple reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can view certain filesystem activity, such as directory names and activity in the directory.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X Folder Manager Directory Permission Error May Let Local Users Obtain the Contents of the Downloads Folder
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Folder Manager.  A local user can obtain the contents of a target user's 'Downloads' folder in certain cases.
When a user deletes their 'Downloads' folder and the Folder Manager recreates the folder, the folder is assigned world-read permissions. A local user can access the folder.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

Graham Perrin of CENTRIM, University of Brighton, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain the contents of a target user's 'Downloads' folder in certain cases.
Solution:

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X DS Tools.  A local user can obtain passwords.
The dscl command-line tool requires passwords as arguments.  As a result, a local user can view the process list to obtain passwords, including administrator passwords.

Title: Mac OS X Heap Overflow in CoreText Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CoreText.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Unicode string that, when processed by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

This can be exploited via web pages, for example.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

Rosyna of Unsanity reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a Unicode string that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Mac OS X Certificate Assistant Temporary File Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Certificate Assistant.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Certificate Assistant does properly handle temporary files.  A local user can exploit this to cause files to be modified with the privileges of a target user running Certificate Assistant.

Description:

A remote user can create a file containing a specially crafted file fork that, when opened by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:

A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Title: Mac OS X Apple File Protocol Server Race Condition Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Apple File Protocol (AFP) Server.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can connect to the target AFP server and enumerate files on the server to trigger a race condition and cause the target server to enter an infinite loop.

Only systems running Mac OS X v10.5.6 are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target server to enter an infinite loop.

Title: IBM AIX 'at' Command Lets Local Users View Arbitrary Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the set user id (setuid) root '/usr/bin/at' command to view arbitrary files on the target system.

iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Solaris Proc Contract File System Pointer Dereference Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges or Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris proc.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a pointer dereference flaw in the process file system (proc(4)) when interacting with the contract(4) file system to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

A local user can also cause a system panic.

The vendor was notified on September 29, 2008.

Ilja van Sprundel from IOActive reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.ioactive.com/pdfs/OpenSolarisUPtrDeref.pdf
Impact':
A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause a system panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_101a or later

x86 Platform

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_101a or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-244026-1

Title: HP-UX IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol Spoofing Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Routing Data in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the HP-UX IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol.  A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases.
A remote user on a physical network of an IPv6 router can spoof Neighbor Discovery messages to update routing information for a target router on a different physical network adjacent to the IPv6 router.  The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.

David Miles reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.
Solution:
HP has issued patches, available at:

http://itrc.hp.com

B.11.11 (11i v1)
PHNE_37898

B.11.23 (11i v2)	
PHNE_37897

B.11.31 (11i v3)
PHNE_38680

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www11.itrc.hp.com/service/cki/docDisplay.do?docId=emr_na-c01662367

Title: Solaris Bug in IP Implementation Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Solaris IP(7p) implementation to open a large number of sockets, denying service to 32-bit applications.  In some cases, this may adversely affect the system.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116965-34 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 114344-37 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 138888-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_82 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116966-33 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 119435-25 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 138889-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_82 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-248026-1

Title: OpenBSD BGP RFC Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The BGP RFC specification allows a remote user to send a specially crafted update with 4-byte AS attributes to cause the target bgpd daemon to close remote BGP sessions.  In some cases, Internet connectivity may be lost.
Impact': A remote user can cause remote BGP sessions to be closed.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available at:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.3/common/009_bgpd.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.4/common/009_bgpd.patch

Title: AIX rmsock Command Lets Local Users Append to Arbitrary Files and Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The rmsock and rmsock64 commands create log files in an unsafe manner.  A local user can exploit this to append data to arbitrary files on the target system.

The following files are affected:

/usr/sbin/rmsock
/usr/sbin/rmsock64
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

6.1.2 IZ41510 To be available 2/25/2009

ftp://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/rmsock_fix.tar

http://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/rmsock_advisory.asc

Title: Solaris IP-in-IP Packet Processing Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the ip(7P) kernel module's IP-in-IP packet processing to trigger a system panic.

Evgeny Sonyagin reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138888-03 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_86 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 119435-26 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 138889-03 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_86 or later

Title: Solaris Pseudo-Terminal Driver Race Condition Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a race condition in the Solaris pseudo-terminal driver (pty(7D)) module to to trigger a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 113685-07 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 140426-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 140383-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_103 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 113686-06 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 140427-01 or later
