Title: Solaris Bug in Processing IPv6 Packets Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet to cause the target system to crash.

Kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Solaris posix_fallocate() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke the the posix_fallocate(3C) system call to trigger a kernel panic.

Solaris 8, 9 and 10 are not affected.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform:

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_29 through snv_90

x86 Platform:

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_29 through snv_90

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-239188-1

Title: Solaris  aio_suspend() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke a system call to trigger an integer overflow in aio_suspend(3RT) and cause a kernel panic.

The vendor was notified on September 15, 2008.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.trapkit.de/advisories/TKADV2009-001.txt

Tobias Klein reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117350-59 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138577-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 121394-02 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117351-59 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138578-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 121395-02 or later

Sun is working on a fix for OpenSolaris.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-247986-1

Title: Sun SNMP Management Agent Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Sun SNMP Management Agent.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a temporary file flaw to overwrite arbitrary files and gain root privileges.

Matthew Flanagan of Singtel Optus Pty Ltd reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix, available at:

http://www.sun.com/download/

SPARC Platform

    * Sun SNMP Management Agent ("SUNWmasf") 1.5.5 or later (For Solaris 8, 9 and 10)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-248646-1

Title: FreeBSD Netgraph and Bluetooth Protocol Stacks Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The kernel does not properly initialize function pointers for netgraph and bluetooth protocol sockets.  A local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

Christer Oberg reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and provided the following solution instructions [quoted].

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_7_0, RELENG_6_4, or RELENG_6_3 security branch dated after the
correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3, 6.4,
and 7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 6.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:13/protosw6x.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:13/protosw6x.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 7.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:13/protosw.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:13/protosw.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:13.protosw.asc

Title: Solaris Name Service Cache Daemon Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris Name Service Cache Daemon.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in nscd(1M) to gain access to information and gain elevated privileges.

Mike Gerdts reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Solaris IP Tunnel Parameter Processing Bug Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can send a specially crafted IOCTL request to trigger a null pointer dereference and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

A local user can also exploit this to cause a system panic.

The vulnerability resides in the tun(7M) IP tunnel parameter processing.

The vendor was notified on September 4, 2007.

Tobias Klein reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.trapkit.de/advisories/TKADV2008-015.txt
Impact':
A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138888-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_77 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138889-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_77 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-242266-1

Description:

Title: Mac OS X UDF Volume Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can create a specially crafted ISO file that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's system to shutdown.

Mauro Notarianni of PCAX Solutions reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's system to shutdown.

Title: Mac OS X Managed Client May Let Local Users Bypass the Screen Saver Lock
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Managed Client.  A physically local user can bypass the screen saver lock.
The Managed Client does not properly identify the system to install the appropriate per-host configuration settings.  As a result, the screen saver lock settings may not be applied.

Systems with built-in Ethernet are not affected.

John Barnes of ESRI, and Trevor Lalish-Menagh of Tamman Technologies, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A physically local user may be able to access the system.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X Libsystem Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Libsystem.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke an application that uses the inet_net_pton API to potentially cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the target application [CVE-2008-4220].

Title: Mac OS X CoreTypes May Not Warn Users Before Opening Unsafe File Types
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CoreTypes.  A user may not be warned before opening certain unsafe file types.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file type that, when downloaded by the target user, will cause the system to fail to warn the user of the potentially unsafe file type.

Content types that have executable permissions but no specific application association are affected.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A user may not be warned before opening certain unsafe file types.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-008 and Mac OS X v10.5.6, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Apple Type Services Bug in Processing Embedded Fonts Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network

Title: Solaris Secure Shell CBC Mode Error Handling May Let Certain Remote Users Obtain Plain Text in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris Secure Shell (SSH).  A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.
A remote user with control of the network between the client and the server can inject connection errors and monitor the SSH error handling response to recover up to 32 bits of plain text from an SSH-protected connection.

The attack process will terminate the SSH connection.

CBC mode connections are affected.

CTR mode connections are not affected.

Martin Albrecht, Kenny Paterson and Gaven Watson from the Information Security Group at Royal Holloway, University of London reported this vulnerability via the Centre for the Protection of National Infrastructure (CPNI).

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.cpni.gov.uk/Docs/Vulnerability_Advisory_SSH.txt
Impact': A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

As a workaround, Sun indicates that you can disable CBC mode ciphers, as described in their advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-247186-1

Title: HP-UX DCE Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on systems running DCE.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

HP-UX B.11.31 running DCE:
Install PHSS_38259 or subsequent

HP-UX B.11.23 running DCE: 
Install PHSS_38258 or subsequent

HP-UX B.11.11 running DCE:
Install PHSS_38183 or subsequent

The vendor's advisory is available at:

Title: Solaris rpc.ypupdated Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code With Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris rpc.ypupdated.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.
When the rpc.ypupdated(1M) daemon is configured in the insecure mode ('-i' option), a remote or local user can execute arbitrary code with root privileges.
Impact': A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 138885-01 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138575-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 139481-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon build snv_90 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 138886-01 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138576-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 139482-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon build snv_90 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-238365-1

Title: Solaris OpenSSL PKCS#11 Engine Session Cache Bug Lets Remote or Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris in the OpenSSL PKCS#11 engine.  A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote or local user can invoke an application that uses the OpenSSL PKCS#11 engine and potentially cause certain cryptographic operations to fail.  The RSA_sign and RSA_verify functions are affected.
Impact': A remote or local user can cause certain cryptographic operations to fail.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 139459-01 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138863-02 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-246846-1

Title: HP-UX Unspecified Kernel Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a kernel panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:

Title: IBM AIX 'crontab' Command Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the IBM AIX 'crontab' command.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with 'aix.system.config.cron' can invoke '/usr/bin/crontab' to gain elevated privileges.

The vendor has assigned APARs IZ34783 IZ34478 IZ30248 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

6.1.1: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ34478

The fixes are also included in AIX 6.1 TL0 Service Pack 7, AIX 6.1 TL1 Service Pack 3, and AIX 6.1 TL2 Service Pack 1.

Title: IBM AIX 'enq' Command Lets Local Users Delete Arbitrary Files
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can delete arbitrary files on the target system.
If a print queue is defined in '/etc/qconfig', a local user can invoke '/usr/bin/enq' to remove arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned APARs IZ34785, IZ34481, and IZ33088 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can delete arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:

Title: IBM AIX 'autoconf6' Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the IBM AIX 'autoconf6' command.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with RBAC 'aix.network.config.tcpip' privileges can invoke '/usr/sbin/autoconf6' to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

The vendor has assigned APARs IZ34753, IZ34393, and IZ30231 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

6.1.1: http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ34393

Title: IBM AIX 'ndp' Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the IBM AIX 'ndp' command.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke '/usr/sbin/ndp' to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges if the netcd daemon is running.

The vendor has assigned APARs IZ35181, IZ35170, and IZ35209 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

6.1.1 (IZ35170): http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ35170

Title: FreeBSD arc4random(9) Generates Predictable Sequences
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD's arc4random(9) random number generator.  The system may generate predictable sequences.
When the arc4random(9) random number generator is initialized, there may be inadequate entropy for up to 5 minutes before arc4random(9) is reseeded with secure entropy from the Yarrow random number generator.

Functions that use arc4random(9) for random sequences may be less secure than intended.

The GEOM ELI providers with onetime keys and GEOM shsec providers are affected.  WEP encryption and authentication is affected.  The IPv4, IPv6 and TCP/UDP protocol implementations are affected.  The RPC code is afffected.

Robert Woolley, Mark Murray, Maxim Dounin, and Ruslan Ermilov reported this vulnerability.
Impact': The system may generate predictable sequences.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and provided the following solution instructions [quoted].

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_7_0, or RELENG_6_3 security branch dated after the correction
date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3 and
7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 7.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:11/arc4random.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:11/arc4random.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 6.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:11/arc4random6x.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:11/arc4random6x.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

NOTE WELL: Any GEOM shsec providers which were created or written to
during the first 300 seconds after booting should be re-created after
applying this security update.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:11.arc4random.asc

Title: (Sun Issues Fix for OpenSolaris) Linux Kernel i915 Driver May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Linux Kernel.  A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  OpenSolaris is affected.
A local user can invoke the DRM_I915_HWS_ADDR ioctl() for Xserver to trigger memory corruption.

The vulnerability resides in 'drivers/char/drm/i915_dma.c'.

Olaf Kirch reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Solaris Socket(3SOCKET) Bug Lets Local Users Crash the System
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
On Solaris systems without InfiniBand hardware, a local user can exploit a flaw in the socket(3SOCKET) function to trigger a system panic.

Solaris 8 and Solaris 9 are not affected.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:

    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_92 or later

x86 Platform

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for iLife and Aperture) LibTIFF Buffer Underflow in Decoding LZW Data Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in LibTIFF.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  Apple iLife and Aperture are affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF file that, when loaded by the target application using libTIFF, will trigger a buffer underflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target application.

The vulnerability resides in 'tif_lzw.c'.

Drew Yao reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Apple has released a fix for iLife Support (8.3.1), which is affected by this vulnerability.

iLife Support 8.3.1 is available via the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Its SHA-1 digest is: 2911f4608c3c69eb8056a5bf6d5186a4f403517d

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3276

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X ImageIO.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF or JPEG file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Robert Swiecki of Google Security Team reported the TIFF file vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Sun Solstice X.25 s_xout Race Condition Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solstice X.25.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user with read permissions for '/dev/xty' can exploit a race condition in '/usr/kernel/strmod/s_xout' trigger a system panic on systems with multiple CPUs.  By default, all users have read permissions for '/dev/xty'.

Description:

A local user can invoke the AdvFS "showfile" command to gain elevated privileges.

Title: OpenBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol Spoofing Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Routing Data in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the OpenBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol.  A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases.
A remote user on a physical network of an IPv6 router can spoof Neighbor Discovery messages to update routing information for a target router on a different physical network adjacent to the IPv6 router.  The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.

David Miles reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued patches:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.4/common/001_ndp.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.3/common/006_ndp.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.2/common/015_ndp.patch

Title: NetBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the NetBSD kernel's IPv6 stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.

Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.

Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a source code fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://ftp.netbsd.org/pub/NetBSD/security/advisories/NetBSD-SA2008-015.txt.asc

The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.

Impact': A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.

Title: Solstice AdminSuite sadmind Buffer Overflow in adm_build_path() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solstice AdminSuite's sadmind.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the adm_build_path() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Solaris 10 does not include sadmind and is not affected.

Adriano Lima reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://risesecurity.org/advisories/RISE-2008001.txt
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116455-02 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 116453-03 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116442-02 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 116454-03 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-245806-1

Title: Mac OS X Script Editor Uses Unsafe Temporary Files That Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Script Editor.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Script Editor uses unsafe temporary files when opening application scripting dictionaries.  A local user can cause the scripting dictionary to be written to an arbitrary path with the privileges of the target user running Script Editor.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-007, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Mac OS X rlogin Bug May Let Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X rlogin.  A remote user may be able to access the target system.
A flaw in rlogind may cause 'hosts.equiv' entries to apply to root logins, even though the manpage indicates that entries do not apply to the root account.  As a result, if rlogin is enabled and systems are specified in 'hosts.equiv', a root user on the remote system (or a user able to spoof the remote system) may be able to access the target system with root privileges.

rlogin is not enabled by default.

Ralf Meyer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to access the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-007, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X QuickLook Bug in Processing Excel Columns Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X QuickLook.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Microsoft Excel file that, when downloaded or viewed by the target user, will trigger a signed variable error in processing Excel columns and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Systems prior to version 10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when downloaded or viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A remote user can create a PostScript file with a specially crafted bounding box comment that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Title: Mac OS X Finder Error Recovery Bug Lets Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Finder.  A user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote or local user can create a specially crafted file that, when placed on the target user's desktop, will cause Finder to terminate when generating the file's icon.  Finder will restart and then terminate again in a continual cycle.  This prevents access to the target user's account.

Systems prior to 10.5 are not affected.

Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote or local user can create a file that, when placed on the target user's desktop, will cause Finder to enter a cycle of terminating and restarting.
Solution:

Title: FreeBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol Spoofing Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Routing Data in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol.  A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases.
A remote user on a physical network of an IPv6 router can spoof Neighbor Discovery messages to update routing information for a target router on a different physical network adjacent to the IPv6 router.  The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.

David Miles reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and provided the following solution instructions [quoted].

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_7_0, or RELENG_6_3 security branch dated after the correction
date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3 and
7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 6.3]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:10/nd6-6.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:10/nd6-6.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 7.0]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:10/nd6-7.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:10/nd6-7.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:10.nd6.asc

Title: Solaris UFS File System acl(2) Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris in acl(2).  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the access control list (ACL) implementation for UFS file systems to trigger a kernel panic.

Systems that have a UFS filesystem are affected.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117350-60 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122300-34 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 139483-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_100 or later 

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117351-60 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-34 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 139484-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_100 or later 

Note: The READMEs of Solaris 8 patches developed on or after 1 April 2009 are available to all customers. However, Solaris 8 entered EOSL Phase 2 on April 1, 2009 and thus entitlement for these patches, including those that fix security vulnerabilities, requires the purchase of the Solaris 8 Vintage Patch Service. More information about the Solaris 8 Vintage Patch Service is available at:

http://www.sun.com/service/eosl/Solaris8.html

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-242267-1

Title: Solaris Text Editors (vi, ex, vedit, view, and edit) Tag Processing Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris text editors.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the processing of tags to execute arbitrary code on the target system with the privileges of another user.

The vi(1), ex(1), vedit(1), view(1), and edit(1) editors are affected.

"Eli the Bearded" reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

    * Solaris 9 with patch 113031-04 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 120830-06 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 116479-02 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 120831-06 or later

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-237987-1

Title: Mac OS X Input Validation Hole in Wiki Server Permits JavaScript Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Wiki Server.  A remote user can conduct JavaScript injection attacks.
The Wiki Server mailing list archive does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can submit a specially crafted e-mail that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Mac OS X Wiki Server software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Matthias Wieczorek of the Chair for Applied Software Engineering, TU Munich and Leon von Tippelskirch reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Wiki Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Mac OS X v10.5.5 and Security Update 2008-006, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Mac OS X v10.5.5 or Security Update 2008-006.

Title: Mac OS X VideoConference Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X VideoConference.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create an H.264 video conference stream that, when joined by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Title: Apple Time Machine Discloses Potentially Sensitive Log Files to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple Time Machine.  A local user can obtain potentially sensitive log files.
When a system is backed up with Time Machine, the system saves several log files to the backup drive with permissions that allow users to view the log files.

Systems prior to version 10.5 are not affected.

Edwin McKenzie reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive log files.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X System Preferences File Sharing Pane Does Not Fully Display the Users Access Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X System Preferences.  A remote authenticated user can access their home directory even though it is not listed on the File Sharing preferences pane.
The File Sharing system preferences screen does not fully convey user access privileges.  As a result, a remote authenticated user has greater access than indicated. 

In addition to directories listed under 'Shared Folders', a remote authenticated user can access their home directory and system administrators can access all disks on the target system.

Systems prior to 10.5 are not affected.

Mac OS X Server systems are not affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access certain directories that are not indicated in the File Sharing system preferences pane.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Mac OS X v10.5.5 and Security Update 2008-006, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X System Preferences VNC Password Display May Mislead Users About the Maximum Password Length
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X System Preferences.  The system may imply that VNC passwords are more robust.
The password entry field of the VNC password system preferences screen accepts more than eight characters even though VNC passwords are limited to eight characters.

Michal Fresel of hi competence e.U. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A user may incorrectly believe that VNC passwords can be longer than eight characters.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Mac OS X v10.5.5 and Security Update 2008-006, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X System Configuration Bug Discloses PPP Password to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X System Configuration.  A local user can obtain the PPP password.
The system stores PPP passwords unencrypted in a world readable file.  A local user can access the file to obtain the passwords.

Systems running 10.5 or later versions are not affected.

Hernan Ochoa of Core Security Technologies, Tore Halset of pvv.org, and Matt Johnston of the University Computer Club reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain the PPP passwords.
Solution:

Title: Apple SearchKit API Integer Overflows May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Apple SearchKit API.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke the API trigger an integer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Title: Apple QuickDraw Manager Integer Overflow in Processing PICT Images Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple QuickDraw Manager.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted PICT image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can create an image file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X Login Window Password Change Bug Lets Local User Access the System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Login Window.  A local user can obtain access to the target system.
A user with access to the login window can exploit a race condition to gain access without providing a password [CVE-2008-3610]. Systems with the Guest account enabled or another account set up with no password are affected.  Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.

On systems configured to enforce policies on login passwords, when a user is required to change their password and the password change fails, the current password may not be cleared.  A user with access to the login window may be able to change a user's password [CVE-2008-3611].  Version 10.5 and later versions are not affected.  Christopher A. Grande of Middlesex Community College reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can access the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Mac OS X v10.5.5 and Security Update 2008-006, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Kernel Credential Caching Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The system does not properly flush cached credentials when a vnode is recycled.  A local user can access files without having the necessary privileges.

Nevin ":-)" Liber, Thomas Pelaia of Oak Ridge National Lab, Thomas Tempelmann, and Ram Kolli reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X ImageIO TIFF and JPEG Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X ImageIO.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF or JPEG file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Title: Mac OS X Finder May Display Incorrect Permissions and Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Finder.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Incorrect permissions may be displayed in certain cases.
A remote user on the local network user can trigger a null pointer dereference in Finder, causing Finder to exit immediately after starting, making the target system unusable [CVE-2008-3613].  Systems running 10.5.2 are affected.  MacBook Air systems running 10.5.3 and 10.5.4 are affected.  Yuxuan Wang of Sogou reported this vulnerability.

In some cases, the 'Get Info' window may not display the proper privileges for a file [CVE-2008-2331].  Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.  Michel Colman reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to become unusuable.

The 'Get Info' window may display incorrect permissions in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Mac OS X v10.5.5 and Security Update 2008-006, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Mac OS X v10.5.5 or Security Update 2008-006.

Title: Mac OS X Heap Overflow in Apple Type Services Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Apple Type Services.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a document with a specially crafted font that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in the processing of PostScript font names and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Mac OS X v10.5.5 and Security Update 2008-006, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies
to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either
Mac OS X v10.5.5 or Security Update 2008-006.

Title: NetBSD Bug in Processing ICMPv6 MLD Queries Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send an ICMPv6 MLD query with a specially crafted  Maximum Response Delay value to trigger a system panic.

Systems compiled with the 'options INET6' option are affected.

Miikka Saukko, Ossi Herrala, and Jukka Taimisto from the CROSS project at Codenomicon Ltd. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a source code fix.

The fix will be included in the future 4.0.1 and 4.1 versions.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://ftp.NetBSD.org/pub/NetBSD/security/advisories/NetBSD-SA2008-011.txt.asc

Title: FreeBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD kernel's IPv6 stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.

Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.

Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and provided the following solution instructions [quoted]:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_6_3 or RELENG_7_0 security branch dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3 and
FreeBSD 7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:09/icmp6.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:09/icmp6.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:09.icmp6.asc

Title: IBM AIX swcons Bug Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user in the system group can create arbitrary files with root permissions.  This can be exploited to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

The vulnerability resides in the 'bos.rte.console' fileset swcons command.

The vulnerability either resides in a fix for a vulnerability that was ostensibly patched in October 2007 or in the patch itself.

iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix:

5.2.0 IZ18335

The vendor plans to issue the following additional fixes:

5.3.0 IZ18339 10/29/2008
5.3.7 IZ18338 10/29/2008
5.3.8 IZ18334 10/29/2008
6.1.0 IZ18341 11/19/2008
6.1.1 IZ28943 11/19/2008

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ18335
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ18339
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ18338
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ18334
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ18341
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ28943

Title: FreeBSD nmount(2) Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD nmount(2) system call.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
If the system is configured to allow unprivileged local users to mount file systems, a local user can invoke nmount(2) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.

James Gritton reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and has provided the following solution instructions [quoted]:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 7-STABLE, or to the RELENG_7_0
security branch dated after the correction date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:08/nmount.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:08/nmount.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:08.nmount.asc

Title: FreeBSD Kernel amd64 swapgs Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can cause the swapgs CPU instruction to be incorreclty executed, allowing the local user to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges.

Systems running the 32 bit FreeBSD/i386 kernel are not affected, even if they have 64-bit capable CPUs.

Nate Eldredge reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and has provided the following solution instructions [quoted]:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 6-STABLE, or 7-STABLE, or to the
RELENG_7_0, or RELENG_6_3 security branch dated after the correction
date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 6.3 and
7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:07/amd64.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:07/amd64.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:07.amd64.asc

Title: Solaris Kernel Lets Local Users Establish Covert Channels
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  Two local users can bypass security restrictions to establish a covert channel.
Two local users can exploit flaws in Solaris kernel system calls to bypass the Solaris Trusted Extensions multi-level security policy or the isolation policy implemented using zones(5) or chroot(2) to establish a covert communications channel.
Impact': Two local users can establish a covert channel.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117350-56 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122300-30 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 137111-05 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_01 through snv_90 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 117351-56 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-30 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 137112-05 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_90 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-240706-1

Title: Solaris NFS RPC Zones Bug Lets Local Administrative Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local administrative user can cause denial of service conditions.
An administrative user in a non-global zone can exploit a flaw in the NFS Remote Procedure Calls (RPC) zones implementation to intercept and corrupt NFS traffic destined for other non-global zones on the system.

Hewitt Associates reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local administrative user can disrupt NFS traffic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138070-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_88 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138071-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_88 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-240866-1

Title: Solaris NFS Kernel Module spec_fsync() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris with certain patches applied.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
On systems with kernel patches 120011-14 (SPARC) and 120012-14 (x86) applied, a local user can create a device file to trigger a flaw in spec_fsync() and cause the target NFS server to panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138070-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_88 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138071-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_88 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-241066-1

Title: NetBSD PPPoE Discovery Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted PPPoE discovery packet to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the kernel to crash.

The system may be affected even if there are no active pppoe(4) interfaces if at least one interface has been created with "ifconfig pppoe0 create".

The report indicates that it is unclear if this flaw can be exploited to trigger code execution.

Yasuoka Masahiko from Internet Initiative Japan Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a source code fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

ftp://ftp.netbsd.org/pub/NetBSD/security/advisories/NetBSD-SA2008-010.txt.asc

Title: Solaris sendfilev() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in sendfilev() to cause a system panic.

This can be exploited by creating a specially crafted web page on a target system that hosts Apache 2.2.x and then remotely loading the page.  This can also be exploited by a local user invoking the sendfile() system call.

When Apache 2.x web servers are compiled without certain compiler switches, the system may be vulnerable to the web-based exploit method.  The configuration of Apache 2.x shipped with Solaris is not affected.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137111-04 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_96 or later

x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137112-04 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_96 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-239186-1

Title: Solaris Trusted Extensions Bug Lets Certain Remote Users Access the Global Zone
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris Trusted Extensions.  A remote user can access the global zone on the target system in certain cases.
A remote user with access to a valid username and password in the global zone of the target system can bypass Mandatory Access Control policy and access the global zone.

If the target Solaris Trusted Extensions system has a labeled zone that is in the "installed" state, the system may be vulnerable.

Solaris 8 and 9 are not affected.
Impact': A remote user with valid authentication data in the global zone can bypass mandatory access controls to access the global zone on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 125100-08 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_68 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 125101-08 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_68 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-240099-1

Title: Solaris Bug in pthread_mutex_reltimedlock_np() Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke the pthread_mutex_reltimedlock_np(3C) API to cause the system to hang or to trigger a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to hang or panic.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix:

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137111-04 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_90 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137112-04 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_90 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-239387-1

Title: Solaris 'snoop' Utility Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris snoop(1M).  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted SMB data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The system is affected if the snoop(1M) utility is invoked without the '-o' command line option.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user, except that for root users the code will run with 'nobody' user privileges.

Gael Delalleau reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix:

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138083-01
    * Solaris 9 with patch 112915-05
    * Solaris 8 with patch 108964-11
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_96 or later


x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 138084-01
    * Solaris 9 with patch 114262-04
    * Solaris 8 with patch 108965-11
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_96 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-240101-1

Title: Solaris namefs Kernel Module Bug Lets Local Users Gain Kernel Privileges or Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the namefs kernel module to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges or cause a kernel panic.
Impact':
A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
Sun has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 114984-02 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 114971-03 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 136716-01 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 114985-02 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 138570-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 136717-01 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-237986-1

Title: Solaris Platform Information and Control Library Daemon Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris Platform Information and Control Library daemon.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in picld(1M) to disable system monitoring and prevent certain system utilities (i.e., prtdiag(1M), prtpicl(1M), prtfru(1M)) from functioning properly.
Impact': A local user can disable system monitoring and prevent certain system utilities from functioning properly.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 8 with patch 112169-07 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 137400-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 138068-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_96 or later


x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 9 with patch 137401-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 138069-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_96 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-239728-1

Title: Mac OS X Quick Look Buffer Overflow in Downloading Microsoft Office Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Quick Look.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Microsoft Office file that, when downloaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can create a Microsoft Office file that, when downloaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Impact: Denial of service via local system

A user can create specially crafted content that, when viewed by an application that uses Data Detectors, will trigger a resource consumption flaw.

Title: Mac OS X Disk Utility emacs Configuration Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Disk Utility.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The 'Repair Permissions' tool in Disk Utility configures '/usr/bin/emacs' with set user id (setuid) privileges.  A local user can subsequently invoke emacs to execute arbitrary commands with system privileges.

Systems running Mac OS X v10.5 and later are not affected.

Anton Rang and Brian Timares reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Apple CoreGraphics Integer Overflow in Processing PDF Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple CoreGraphics.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Pariente Kobi reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can create a PDF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-005), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Apple CoreGraphics Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple CoreGraphics.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in CoreGraphics and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Other applications that pass untrusted input to CoreGraphics may be able to be used to exploit this.

Michal Zalewski of Google reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-005), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Mac OS X CarbonCore Stack Overflow in Processing Filenames Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CarbonCore.  A user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted filename that, when process by the target application, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Thomas Raffetseder of the International Secure Systems Lab and Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a filename that, when loaded by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-005), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/
