Title: HP-UX System Administration Manager May Grant Users Remote Access to NFS Servers
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX in the System Administration Manager.  A remote user can gain access.
When the System Administration Manager is used to configure NFS, the system may generate a non-secure configuration that grants access to all NFS systems.
Impact': A remote user can access NFS systems that have been configured via the manager.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

HP-UX B.11.11 (11i v1):  Install PHCO_36562 or subsequent; change NFS configuration as needed

HP-UX B.11.23 (11i v2):  Install PHCO_36563 or subsequent; change NFS configuration as needed

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01367453

Title: Mac OS X Dock Function Lets Physically Local Users Bypass the Screen Lock
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Dock function.  A physically local user can bypass the screen lock.
When the screen lock or sleep password is enabled and Expos  hot corners are set, a physically local user can bypass the screen lock to access the system.

Systems prior to Mac OS X 10.5 are not affected.

Andrew Cassell of Marine Spill Response Corporation for reporting this issue.
Impact': A physically local user can bypass the screen lock to access the system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-004 and Mac OS X 10.5.4), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2163

Title: Mac OS X User Template Directory Permissions Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can populate the User Template directory with files that will become part of the home directory of a new user when the new user is created.  A local user can exploit this flaw to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the target (new) user.

Systems running Mac OS X 10.5 or later are not affected.

Andrew Mortensen of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-004 and Mac OS X 10.5.4), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2163

Title: Mac OS X Launch Services File Download Symlink Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Launch Services.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a race condition in validating symbolic links and open a file on the target user's system.  This may cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The system is affected if the "Open 'safe' files" preference is enabled in Safari.

Systems running Mac OS X 10.5 or later are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can create a HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-004 and Mac OS X 10.5.4), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2163

Title: Mac OS X Format String Flaw in c++filt() Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.
A user can supply a specially crafted string to c++filt() to trigger a format string bug and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Systems prior to Mac OS X 10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-004 and Mac OS X 10.5.4), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2163

Title: Mac OS X CoreTypes May Not Warn Users Before Opening Unsafe File Types
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CoreTypes.  A user may not be warned before opening certain unsafe file types.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file type (.xht and .xhtm) that, when downloaded by the target user, will cause the system to fail to warn the user of the potentially unsafe file type.

Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A user may not be warned before opening certain unsafe file types.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-004 and Mac OS X 10.5.4), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2163

Title: Mac OS X Alias Manager Memory Corruption Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Alias Manager.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted AFP volume mount information.  When an alias for the volume is resolved by the target user, arbitrary code will be executed on the target user's system.

Intel-based systems running Mac OS X 10.5.1 or prior versions are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-004 and Mac OS X 10.5.4), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2163

Title: Solaris snmpXdmid Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target Sun Solstice Enterprise SNMP-DMI mapper subagent daemon (snmpXdmid(1M)) to cause the daemon to crash.

IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 8 with patch 108869-35 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 137402-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 128415-01 or later

x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 8 with patch 108870-35 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 137403-01 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 128416-01 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-237985-1

Title: Mac OS X Apple Remote Desktop Agent Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Apple Remote Desktop Agent.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke the Apple Remote Desktop Agent and supply AppleScript to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

A demonstration exploit command is provided:

osascript -e 'tell app "ARDAgent" to do shell script "whoami"'

Some versions of 10.4 may not be affected.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix (Security Update 2008-005), which can be downloaded and installed via Software Update preferences, or from Apple Downloads at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT2647

A fixed version of Apple Remote Desktop (3.2.2) is also available.  The fixed version is not required if patch 2008-005 has been applied.

Apple Remote Desktop 3.2.2 may be obtained from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

For Apple Remote Desktop 3.2.2 Client
The download file is named:  "RemoteDesktopClient.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  b1a81f17724d9b2f7b6dbffed56bc9a0463d1d7e

For Apple Remote Desktop 3.2.2 Admin
The download file is named:  "RemoteDesktopAdmin322.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  d9657c10ed4bc29cfe8cc64e0727ffd4ed8a1425

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3145

Title: Solaris e1000g Gigabit Ethernet Driver Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris in the e1000g Gigabit Ethernet driver.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
On systems with Intel 82571/82572 network interface controllers, a remote user can block all inbound network traffic.
Impact': A remote user can block inbound network traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137289-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_93 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137293-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_93 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-238250-1

Title: Solaris IP Multicast Filter Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service or Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can send a specially crafted SIOCSIPMSFILTER IOCTL request to execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges on the target system.

A local user can also trigger a kernel panic.

The vendor was notified on August 20, 2007.

Tobias Klein reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.trapkit.de/advisories/TKADV2008-003.txt
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137111-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_92 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137112-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_92 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-237965-1

Title: Solaris on UltraSPARC T2 and UltraSPARC T2+ Kernel Module Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a flaw in the processor specific kernel module for Sun UltraSPARC T2 and UltraSPARC T2+ systems to cause a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137111-01 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_93 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-238688-1

Title: Solaris Event Port Implementation Null Pointer Dereference Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris in the event port implementation.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke an application program that submits and retrieves user-defined events from a port to trigger null pointer dereference, causing a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a system panic.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137111-01 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 137112-01 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-235122-1

Title: Solaris Tag Service Registry Bug Lets Local Users Fill the '/var' Filesystem
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can consume excessive disk space.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Solaris Service Tag Registry to fill the '/var' filesystem.

Sun Service Tag 1.0, 1.1, and 1.2 are affected.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on applications and services that use the target '/var' filesystem.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes [quoted].

SPARC Platform

    *  Solaris 10 8/07 or Java Enterprise System (Java ES) 5 under
       Solaris 10 with patch 136839-01 or higher

    *  For Solaris 8, 9, and 10 systems on which Sun Service Tag was manually installed via a download from the Sun Download Center, version 1.1.3 or higher should be retrieved via the "Download Service Tags" link at:

      https://inventory.sun.com/inventory/

Then, the current packages should be removed:

      # pkgrm SUNWstosreg SUNWservicetagu SUNWservicetagr

and finally the new packages should be installed, via pkgadd(1M),
as mentioned in the enclosed README from the Service Tag download.


x86 Platform

    *  Solaris 10 8/07 or Java Enterprise System (Java ES) 5 under Solaris 10 with patch 136840-01 or higher

    *  For Solaris 10 systems on which Sun Service Tag was manually installed via a download from the Sun Download Center, version 1.1.3 or higher should be retrieved via the "Download Service Tags" link at:

      https://inventory.sun.com/inventory/

Then, the current packages should be removed:

      # pkgrm SUNWstosreg SUNWservicetagu SUNWservicetagr

and finally the new packages should be installed, via pkgadd(1M),
as mentioned in the enclosed README from the Service Tag download. 


Enterprise Linux platforms

The enterprise Linux version of Sun Service Tag,  version 1.1.3 or 
higher should be retrieved via the "Download Service Tags" link at:

      https://inventory.sun.com/inventory/

Then, the current packages should be removed:

      # rpm -e sun-servicetag

and finally the new packages should be installed, via "rpm -i"
as mentioned in the enclosed README from the Service Tag download.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-238414-1

Title: Solaris Crontab Injection Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Crontab on Sun Solaris.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a race condition in the crontab(1) utility to inject arbitrary cron(1M) jobs into a target user's crontab file, which will then be executed with the privileges of the target user.

Charles Morris of Old Dominion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain cause arbitrary code to be executed with the privileges of the target user, including root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 109007-26 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122300-27 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 137017-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_93 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 109008-26 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-27 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 137018-02 or later
    * OpenSolaris based upon builds snv_93 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-237864-1

Title: Mac OS X ImageIO Bugs Disclose Memory Contents to Local Users and Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X ImageIO.  A local user can view portions of system memory.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A user can create a specially crafted BMP or GIF file that, when loaded, will trigger an out-of-bounds memory read in the BMP and GIF image decoding engine and disclose potentially sensitive memory contents to the user [CVE-2008-1573].  Gynvael Coldwind of Hispasec reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG2000 image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2008-1574].  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
Impact':
A local user can view portions of system memory.

A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-003 and Mac OS X v10.5.3, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Security Update 2008-003 or Mac OS X v10.5.3.

Title: Apple Wiki Server Discloses Usernames to Remote Users
Version(s): Mac OS X Server v10.5 through v10.5.2
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple Wiki Server.  A remote user can determine user names.
A remote user can access a nonexistent blog on the Wiki Server on Mac OS X Server.  Based on information returned in the error message, the remote user can determine local user names.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

Don Rainwater of the University of Cincinnati reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine valid user names on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-003 and Mac OS X v10.5.3, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Single Sign-On Discloses Passwords to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Single Sign-On.  A local user can obtain passwords.
Passwords are supplied to the sso_util command-line tool as command line arguments.  A local user can potentially view the passwords and then gain elevated privileges.

This includes user passwords, administrator passwords, and the KDC administration password.

Geoff Franks of Hauptman Woodward Institute reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain passwords.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-003 and Mac OS X v10.5.3, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Security Update 2008-003 or Mac OS X v10.5.3.

For Mac OS X v10.5.2
The download file is named: "MacOSXUpd10.5.3.dmg"

Title: Mac OS X Image Capture Lets Local Users View Files and Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Image Capture.  A local user can view files and obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can load a specially crafted URL to exploit a path traversal flaw in the Image Capture embedded web server and obtain files on the target system [CVE-2008-1571].

The system uses unsafe temporary files [CVE-2008-1572].  A local user can cause files to be overwritten by a target user with the privileges of the target user.  A local user can also access the contents of images being resized by the target user.

Systems running Mac OS X v10.5 and later are not affected by either of these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can view files on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-003 and Mac OS X v10.5.3, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Security Update 2008-003 or Mac OS X v10.5.3.

Title: Mac OS X ICU Character Encoding Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Content Filters
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the processing of certain character encodings.  A remote user can bypass content filters.
The International Components for Unicode (ICU) component does not properly handle certain character encodings.

A remote user can create character sequences that may not appear in the converted output, allowing the remote user to create content that bypasses content filters.  This may also allow cross-site scripting attacks.
Impact': A remote user can create content that may bypass content filters or permit cross-site scripting attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-003 and Mac OS X v10.5.3, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X CoreTypes May Not Warn Users Before Opening Unsafe File Types
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CoreTypes.  A user may not be warned before opening certain unsafe file types.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file type that, when downloaded by the target user, will cause the system to fail to warn the user of the potentially unsafe file type.

Automator, Help, Safari, and Terminal are affected.

Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A user may not be warned before opening certain unsafe file types.
Solution:

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network

A user can create specially crafted CFData objects to trigger a heap overflow in CFDataReplaceBytes() and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Title: Mac OS X Apple Type Services Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Apple Type Services.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a PDF file containing specially crafted embedded fonts that, when printed by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 are not affected.

Title: Mac OS X Apple File Protocol Server Discloses Files to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Apple File Protocol (AFP) server.  A remote user can view files that are not designated for sharing.
A remote user can access files and directories on the target system that are located within folders not designated for sharing.

Alex deVries and Robert Rich reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files that are in folders that are not designated for sharing.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-003 and Mac OS X v10.5.3, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either Security Update 2008-003 or Mac OS X v10.5.3.

Title: Solaris STREAMS Administrative Driver Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Solaris STREAMS Administrative Driver.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a race condition in the STREAMS Administrative Driver (sad(7D)) to trigger a kernel panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127743-01 or later

x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127744-01 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-237584-1

Title: IBM AIX ftpd Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Determine the Installation Path
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the IBM AIX ftp daemon.  A remote user can determine the installation path.
A remote authenticated user (including an anonymous user) can issue a 'quote cwd' command to determine the full path of the home directory of the ftp user.

ISS X-Force reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can determine the installation path.
Solution:
IBM plans to issue the following APARs on June 20, 2008:

5.2.0  IZ18670
5.3.0  IZ22357
5.3.7  IZ22358
5.3.8  IZ21529
6.1.0  IZ22356

ftp://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/ftpd_fix.tar

Title: IBM AIX Input Validation Flaw in iostat Command Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX in the iostat command.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke the 'usr/bin/iostat' command with a specially crafted environment variable value to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following APAR:

5.2.0  IZ20635

The vendor plans to issue the following APARs on June 20, 2008:

5.3.0  IZ22350
5.3.7  IZ22351
5.3.8  IZ21506
6.1.0  IZ22349

Title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in errpt Command May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

The vulnerability resides in '/usr/bin/errpt', which is configured with set user id (setuid) root privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following APAR:

5.2.0  IZ19905

The vendor plans to issue the following APARs on June 20, 2008:

5.3.0  IZ22346
5.3.7  IZ22347
5.3.8  IZ21494
6.1.0  IZ22348

Title: IBM AIX Kernel Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges or Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the kernel to execute arbitrary code with kernel mode privileges or to cause the system to halt.

The following files are affected:

    /usr/lib/boot/unix_64
    /usr/lib/boot/unix_mp
    /usr/lib/boot/unix_up
Impact':
A local user can obtain kernel privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause the target system to halt.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following APAR:

5.2.0  IZ19911

The vendor plans to issue the following APARs on June 20, 2008.

5.3.0  IZ22368
5.3.7  IZ22369
5.3.8  IZ21481
6.1.0  IZ22370

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ22370

Title: HP-UX addpath Bug Lets Local Users Access Files on the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX.  A local user can access files on the target system.
A local user can exploit the useradd(1M) function to access files and directories on the target system.
Impact': A local user can access files and directories on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following patches, available at:

http://itrc.hp.com

HP-UX B.11.11 	PHCO_37290 or subsequent
HP-UX B.11.23 	PHCO_37291 or subsequent
HP-UX B.11.31 	PHCO_36953 or subsequent

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01455884

Title: Solaris TCP SYN Attack Protection Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions in certain situations.
When a target system is undergoing a TCP SYN flood attack, a remote user can cause the target system to be slow to accept new network connections, causing the network connections to time out before establishing a connection.  On uniprocessor systems, the remote user can cause excessive CPU usage.

Systems that are configured with a 'tcp_conn_req_max_q0' value that is signficantly higher than the default value of 1024 are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch116965-33 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 114344-35 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 119998-01 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116966-32 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 119435-23 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 119999-01 or later

Note: There are additional Solaris 8 and 9 patches which list 6402737 in their README, however these patches are not required to address the issue described in this Sun Alert. These additional patches deliver an updated kernel debugger (kadb(1M)). The patch-IDs are:

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 patch 117350-54 or later
    * Solaris 9 patch 122300-25 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 patch 117351-54 or later
    * Solaris 9 patch 122301-25 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-200864-1

Title: HP-UX LDAP Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX when running LDAP.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
No details were provided.

LDAP-UX versions B.04.10 to B.04.15 are affected.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (LDAP-UX vB.04.17).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01447010

Title: Solaris SCTP Response Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SCTP protocol data to cause the target system to create a flood of response messages.  System performance may degrade or the target system may hang.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127127-08 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127128-08 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-236521-1

Title: Solaris SCTP Protocol Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SCTP protocol data to cause the target system to miscount buffers and crash.

Solaris 8 and 9 are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127127-08 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127128-08 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-236321-1

Title: Solaris Floating Point Context Switch Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Floating Point Context Switch implementation to cause an application on the target system to crash or obtain incorrect results from a floating point operation.  The user cannot select which application will crash.

Applications executing floating point operations may get incorrect results.

On Solaris 10, applications using the libc(3LIB) functions memcpy(3C), memset(3C), or memmove(3C) may get incorrect results.
Impact': A local user can cause floating point calculation errors.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix.

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 122301-23 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 127112-10 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-233921-1

Title: Solaris Trusted Extensions Bug Lets Local Applications Bypass Labeled Networking Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris Trusted Extensions.  A local application can bypass label restrictions.
A local untrusted application in a labeled zone can exchange data with an application in a separate labeled zone.
Impact': A local untrusted application in a labeled zone can exchange data with an application in a separate labeled zone.
Solution:
Sun is working on a final fix.  Interim Security Relief (ISR) patches are available.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-235421-1

Title: Solaris Bug in ip_rput_local_options() in Processing Self Encapsulated IP Packets Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send a self encapsulated IP packet with a specially crafted time stamp option to trigger a system panic.

The vulnerability resides in ip_rput_local_options().
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116965-32 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 114344-34 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 127111-11 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 8 with patch 116966-31 or later
    * Solaris 9 with patch 119435-22 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 127112-11 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-235901-1

Title: SCO UnixWare pkgadd Directory Traversal Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in pkgadd on SCO UnixWare.  A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A local user can set specially crafted environment variable values to cause pkgadd to create or append to arbitrary files on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor was notified on September 4, 2007.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch (p534589).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.sco.com/support/update/download/release.php?rid=324

Title: Solaris inetd Symlink Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris inetd.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to '/var/tmp/inetd.log' (if it exists).  When inetd(1M) writes to the log file, the symlinked file will be overwritten.

Solaris 8 and 9 are not affected.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127718-05 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127719-05 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-233284-1

Title: Sun SPARC Enterprise T5120 and T5220 Default Configuration Permits Remote Root Command Execution
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 10; Sun SPARC Enterprise T5120 and T5220 with datecode prior to BEL07480000
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris 10 on certain Sun SPARC Enterprise T5120 and T5220 systems.  A remote or local user can execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.
The system ships with an insecure configuration that allows local and remote users to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.

Sun SPARC Enterprise T5120 and T5220 systems with a datecode prior to BEL07480000 are affected.
Impact': A remote or local user can execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.
Solution:
Sun SPARC Enterprise T5120 and T5220 servers with datecode BEL07480000 and later ship with the correct configuration.

A workaround for prior versions is described in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-231244-1

Title: IBM AIX 'chnfsmnt' Utility Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The '/usr/sbin/chnfsmnt' utility does not specify full path names when calling certain binaries.  A local user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APAR IZ18296).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ18296

Title: Mac OS X NetCfgTool Lets Local Users Obtain System Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X NetCfgTool.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted message to NetCfgTool to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X PAX Archive Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted pax archive that, when processed by the target user, will trigger an array index overflow and execute arbitrary code.

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can create a pax archive that, when processed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X CoreServices Lets Remote Users Open Certain Files Using AppleWorks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CoreServices.  A remote user can cause certain files to be opened in AppleWorks on the target user's system.
If the "Open 'Safe' files" preference is enabled in Safari, a remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will open the specified remote '.ief' file using AppleWorks.

Only systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 that have AppleWorks installed are affected.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause a remote '.ief' file to be opened on target user's system using AppleWorks.
Solution:

Title: Apple CoreFoundation Integer Overflow in Processing Time Zone Data Lets Local Users Obtain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple Mac OS X CoreFoundation.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted time zone data to trigger an integer overflow in CoreFoundation and execute arbitrary code with system privileges.

Mac OS X versions 10.5 or later are not affected.
Impact': A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Mac OS X UDF File System Null Pointer Dereference Lets Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Universal Disc Format (UDF) file system support.  A user can cause denial of service conditions.
A user can create a specially crafted UDF disk image that, when opened, will trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the system to shutdown.

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.

Paul Wagland of Redwood Software and Wayne Linder of Iomega reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Printing Uses Weak Encryption and Discloses Passwords to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Printing component.  A user can decrypt files or obtain passwords.
When the system prints to an encrypted PDF file, the system uses 40-bit RC4 [CVE-2008-0995].

When a job is started on an authenticated print queue, the authentication credentials may be saved to disk [CVE-2008-0996].  A local user may be able to obtain the passwords.

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.
Impact':
A local user may be able to obtain passwords.

The system uses weak encryption to print encrypted PDF files.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Mac OS X Preview Saves Encrypted PDF Files Using Weak Encryption
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Preview.  The software stores encrypted PDF files using weak encryption.
When a user saves a Preview file to an encrypted PDF file, Preview uses 40-bit RC4 encryption.
Impact': The software stores encrypted PDF files using weak encryption.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X Server Podcast Producer Discloses Passwords to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Podcast Producer.  A local user can obtain passwords.
The Podcast Capture application supplies passwords to a subtask through arguments.  A local user may be able to view the arguments.

Title: Mac OS X notifyd Lets Local Users Prevent Processes from Receiving Notifications
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X notifyd.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can send a Mach port death notification to notifyd so that applications that use the notify(3) call to register for notifications will not receive the notifications.

Mac OS X versions 10.5 or later are not affected.
Impact': A local user can prevent applications from receiving notifications from notifyd.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X mDNSResponder Format String Flaw Lets Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X mDNSResponder.  A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can set a specially crafted hostname value to trigger a format string flaw in mDNSResponderHelper and execute arbitrary code.  The code will run with the privileges of mDNSResponderHelper (system privileges).

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with system privileges.
Solution:

Title: Apple Wiki Server Path Traversal Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple Wiki Server.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user with wiki edit privileges can exploit a path traversal flaw to upload arbitrary code to the target system and then cause the wiki server to execute the code.  The code will run with the privileges of the wiki server.

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.

The vendor was notified on January 30, 2008.

Rodrigo Carvalho of CORE Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.coresecurity.com/?action=item&id=2189
Impact': A remote user with wiki edit privileges can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Image Raw Stack Overflow in Processing Adobe Digital Negative (DNG) Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X Image Raw.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Adobe Digital Negative (DNG) file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.

Clint Ruoho of Laconic Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a DNG image file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Mac OS X Application Firewall German Language Preference Panel May Mislead Users and Incorrectly Permit Services to Accept Connections
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Application Firewall.  The German language preference pane is misleading.
The German language translation of the Application Firewall preference pane listed the "Set access for specific services and applications" radio button as "Zugriff auf bestimmte Dienste und Programme festlegen" (i.e., "Set access to specific services and applications").

A user may incorrectly believe that only the listed services are permitted to accept incoming connections.

Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.
Impact': A user may incorrectly believe that only the listed services are permitted to accept incoming connections.
Solution:

Title: Mac OS X Foundation Bugs in NSURLConnection and NSXML Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Foundation.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a race condition in NSURLConnection's cache management and cause a deallocated object to receive messages [CVE-2008-0058].  As a result, the application may crash or execute arbitrary code.

Daniel Jalkut of Red Sweater Software reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted XML document that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a race condition in NSXML and crash the application or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-0059].

Mac OS X versions 10.5 or later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Mac OS X Foundation Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Foundation.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A specially crafted selector name to the NSSelectorFromString API to trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0054].

When a target user performs a recursive file copying operation, the NSFileManager function creates directories, temporarily with world-writable privileges.  A local user can modify the directories to potentially gain elevated privileges [CVE-2008-0055].

A pathname with a specially crafted structure can trigger a stack overflow in NSFileManager [CVE-2008-0056].

Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Apple AppKit Integer and Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in AppKit.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted serialized property list that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0057].  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The vulnerability resides in a parser for a legacy serialization format.

A remote user that can cause a target user to query a network printer and then supply a specially rafted PPD file can trigger a stack overflow and cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system [CVE-2008-0997].

Mac OS X versions 10.5 or later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Title: Apple AppKit Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in AppKit.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke the NSDocument API with a specially crafted filename to trigger a stack overflow and, on some filesystems, execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0048].  On most filesystems, code execution is not possible.

A local user can also access a mach port in NSApplication and send specially crafted messages to privileged applications in the same bootstrap namespace to cause the target application to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-0049].

Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Apple File Protocol Server Kerberos Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Apple File Protocol (AFP) server.  A remote user can bypass authentication.
The server does not properly validate Kerberos principal realm names.  When cross-realm authentication with and AFP Server is used, a remote user can bypass cross-realm authentication to connect to the server.

Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected.

Ragnar Sundblad of KTH - Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication and connect to the server.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Security Update 2008-002, available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Apple File Protocol Client Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Apple File Protocol (AFP) Client.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted 'afp://' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Title: IBM AIX Kernel Bugs Let Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Access Data, and Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the IBM AIX kernel.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local 64-bit process that is restarted via the checkpoint and restart feature can gain read and write access to certain portions of kernel memory.  A local user can exploit this to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges.

A user on a remote node of a concurrent volume group can reduce the size of a JFS2 filesystem residing on the concurrent volume group can cause a remote node to crash.

When the permission on a directory on a proc filesystem is more restrictive than the permission on an executing file in that directory, directory access controls are not properly enforced.

When a user make modifications via hard links, Trusted Execution does not properly protect files.  This vulnerability only affects AIX 6.1.

A local user can invoke some WPAR specific system calls to cause denial of service conditions.  This vulnerability only affects AIX 6.1.

A local user with privileges to run ProbeVue can read arbitrary kernel memory locations.  This vulnerability only affects AIX 6.1.  The following files are affected:

    /usr/lib/boot/unix_64
    /usr/lib/boot/unix_mp
    /usr/lib/boot/unix_up
    /usr/lib/drivers/hd_pin
    /usr/sbin/lreducelv

IBM discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

For 5.2.0: APAR IZ16992
For 5.3.0: APAR IZ17111 (to be available 3/17/2008)
For 5.3.7: APAR IZ11820 (to be available 3/17/2008)
For 6.1.0: APAR IZ12794

The vendor advisories are available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ16992
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ17111
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ11820
http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ12794

Title: IBM AIX 'nddstat' Commands Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit certain 'nddstat' commands to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

The following files are affected:

    /usr/sbin/atmstat
    /usr/sbin/entstat
    /usr/sbin/fddistat
    /usr/sbin/hdlcstat
    /usr/sbin/tokstat

IBM discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

For 5.2.0: APAR IZ16991
For 5.3.0: APAR IZ17058 (to be available on 3/17/2008)
For 5.3.7: APAR IZ17059 (to be available on 3/17/2008)
For 6.1.0: APAR IZ16975

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX in the lsmcode command.  A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in '/usr/sbin/lsmcode' to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

IBM discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

Title: IBM AIX Buffer Overflow in 'reboot' Command Lets Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user in the 'shutdown' group can can invoke '/usr/sbin/reboot' trigger a stack overflow to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.

IBM discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user in the 'shutdown' gropu can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

For 5.2.0:  APAR IZ15479

For 5.3.0:  APAR IZ15480 (to be available 3/17/2008).

The vendor advisories are available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ15480

Title: IBM AIX 'man' Utility May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The '/usr/bin/man' utility does not specify the full path when invoking certain binaries.  A local user may be able to cause a target user running 'man' to execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Impact': A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APAR IZ17177).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ17177

Title: NetBSD  fast_ipsec() Endian Order Lets Remote Users Bypass IPSec Policy Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD in the IPSec implementation.  A remote user can bypass security restrictions.
A remote user can bypass IPSec policy by establishing a security association using a different byte order than the target NetBSD system (which assumes host endian order).

The vulnerability resides in the fast_ipsec(4) ipsec4_get_ulp() function.

Kernels compiled with the 'options FAST_IPSEC' option are affected.

Karl Knutsson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass IPSec policy that is based on protocol and port number parameters.
Solution:
NetBSD has issued a fix.

The NetBSD advisory is available at:

ftp://ftp.NetBSD.org/pub/NetBSD/security/advisories/NetBSD-SA2008-002.txt.asc

Title: (NetBSD Issues Fix) KAME IPv6 Stack Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Sending an IPv6 Packet Containing an IPComp Header
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the KAME IPv6 Stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send an IPv6 packet with an IPComp header to cause the target service to crash.

Shoichi Sakane of the KAME project reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/110947

Apple Mac OS X xnu is also affected.  A demonstration exploit from mu-b of digit-labs.org is available at:

http://www.digit-labs.org/files/exploits/xnu-ipv6-ipcomp.c
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
NetBSD has released a fix.  NetBSD kernels compiled with the 'options IPSEC' option are affected.

The NetBSD advisory is available at:

ftp://ftp.NetBSD.org/pub/NetBSD/security/advisories/NetBSD-SA2008-003.txt.asc

Title: (Apple Mac OS X is Affected) KAME IPv6 Stack Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Sending an IPv6 Packet Containing an IPComp Header
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the KAME IPv6 Stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Apple Mac OS X is affected.
A remote user can send an IPv6 packet with an IPComp header to cause the target service to crash.

Shoichi Sakane of the KAME project reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/110947

Apple Mac OS X xnu is also affected.  A demonstration exploit from mu-b of digit-labs.org is available at:

http://www.digit-labs.org/files/exploits/xnu-ipv6-ipcomp.c
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution for Apple Mac OS X was available at the time of this entry.

Title: OpenBSD IPv6 Routing Header Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD.  A remote user can cause a kernel panic.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 routing header to trigger a kernel panic on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.2/common/008_ip6rthdr.patch

Title: OpenBSD Kernel tcp_respond() Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD.  A remote user can cause a kernel panic.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to trigger a flaw in tcp_respond() and trigger a kernel panic.
Impact': A remote user can the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following patches:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.1/common/013_tcprespond.patch
ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.2/common/007_tcprespond.patch

Title: Solaris CPU Performance Counters Subsystem Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit two race condition vulnerabilities in the CPU Performance Counters (cpc(3CPC) subsystem to trigger a kernel panic.

The kcpc_restore() and kcpc_unbind() functions can trigger these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fix.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127111-08 or later

x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127112-08 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-231466-1

Title: Solaris DTrace May Let Local Users Obtain Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris in the DTrace dynamic tracing framework.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with PRIV_DTRACE_USER or PRIV_DTRACE_PROC privileges can exploit a flaw in DTrace to perform some kernel-level tracing.  As a result, the local user may then be able to access potentially sensitive information.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
Sun has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform:

    * Solaris 10 without patch 120011-04

x86 Platform:

    * Solaris 10 without patch 120012-04

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-231803-1

Title: IBM AIX HACMP File Permission Bug Lets Local Users Modify Temporary Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX's High Availability Cluster Multi-Processing environment.  A local user can modify certain temporary files on the target system.
The system creates temporary files '/tmp/run_clappmond.err.<monitor_id>' with unsafe permissions.  Any user can modify the files.

[Editor's note:  The vendor did not indicate whether a symlink privilege escalation attack is possible or not.]
Impact': A local user can modify certain temporary files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (IZ11121 and IZ15917).

The IBM advisories are available at:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ11121
http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=isg1IZ15917

Title: Solaris x86 vuidmice STREAMS Modules Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can supply a specially crafted VUIDGWHEELCOUNT IOCTL value to exploit a flaw in the vuidmice STREAMS modules (vuidmice (7M)) and cause a kernel panic.

The SPARC platform is not affected.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 9 with patch 117419-04 or later
    * Solaris 10 with patch 127751-02 or later

The Sun advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-66-200635-1

Title: FreeBSD sendfile() Discloses Write-only File Contents to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD sendfile(2) call.  A local user can view file contents of write-only files.
The sendfile(2) system call fails to properly check the file permissions before accessing a file.  A local user can invoke sendfile to send data from a file that has write-only permissions.

Kostik Belousov reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can view file contents of write-only files.
Solution:
The vendor has provided the following solution information [quoted]:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 5-STABLE, 6-STABLE, or
7.0-PRERELEASE, or to the RELENG_7_0, RELENG_6_3, RELENG_6_2,
RELENG_6_1, or RELENG_5_5 security branch dated after the correction
date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 5.5, 6.1,
6.2, 6.3, and 7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 6.2, 6.3, and 7.0]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:03/sendfile.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:03/sendfile.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 6.1]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:03/sendfile61.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:03/sendfile61.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 5.5]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:03/sendfile55.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:03/sendfile55.patch.asc

b) Apply the patch.

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile your kernel as described in
<URL:http://www.FreeBSD.org/handbook/kernelconfig.html> and reboot the
system.

The FreeBSD advisory is available at:

http://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:03.sendfile.asc

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for OS X) Apple iPhone URL Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple iPhone.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  Mac OS X is affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix (Mac OS X v10.5.2 and Security Update 2008-001), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

Its SHA-1 digest is:  524e0a707afbdeff798cdd9464d62f672136ab5a

Title: Mac OS X Terminal Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Applications
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A remote user can cause specified applications to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user from within Terminal, will cause a specified application on the target user's system to be executed with user-supplied command line arguments.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Olli Leppanen of Digital Film Finland and Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute applications on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Mac OS X v10.5.2 and Security Update 2008-001), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Apple Parental Controls Discloses Status Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple Parental Controls.  A remote user can determine when a website is unblocked.
The system contacts an Apple web site (www.apple.com) when a website is unblocked.  A remote user monitoring the network can determine when a website is unblocked.

Jesse Pearson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine when a website is unblocked.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Mac OS X v10.5.2 and Security Update 2008-001), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Time Machine Backup Lets Local Users Execute Deleted Applications
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Time Machine backup feature.  A local user can execute applications that have been deleted.
A local user can invoke Launch Services to execute an application that was backed up using Time Machine but later deleted from the system.

Systems prior to version 10.5 are not affected.

Steven Fisher of Discovery Software Ltd. and Ian Coutier reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can execute deleted applications on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Mac OS X v10.5.2 and Security Update 2008-001), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

Title: Mac OS X Buffer Overflow in Directory Services Lets Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the Service Location Protocol (SLP) daemon to execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.

Mac OS X v10.5 or later is not affected.

Kevin Finisterre of Netragard reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Mac OS X v10.5.2 and Security Update 2008-001), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The Software Update utility will present the update that applies
to your system configuration. Only one is needed, either
Mac OS X v10.5.2 or Security Update 2008-001.

Title: AIX 'ps' Command Discloses Process Environment Variables to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX.  A local user can view process environment variables.
A local user can invoke the 'ps' command to view the values of all processes environment variables.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://rawlab.mindcreations.com/codes/exp/nix/ibmaixps.sh

Andrea "bunker" Purificato reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can view process environment variables.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issued the following fixes:

        5.2.0               IZ11242            05/14/08
        5.3.0               IZ12745            04/30/08
        5.3.7               IZ11243            04/30/08
        6.1.0               IZ11244            02/20/08

An efix is available at:

ftp://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/ps_ifix.tar

Title: AIX Buffer Overflow in pioout Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AIX.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted command line option to trigger a buffer overflow in '/usr/lib/lpd/pio/etc/pioout' and execute arbitrary code on the target system with root level privileges.

IBM has assigned APAR numbers IZ10840, IZ10841, IZ10842, and IZ10844 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on November 29, 2007.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue the following APARs (with availability date listed):

        5.2.0               IZ10840            05/14/08
        5.3.0               IZ10841            02/06/08
        5.3.7               IZ10842            02/06/08
        6.1.0               IZ10844            02/20/08

ftp://aix.software.ibm.com/aix/efixes/security/pioout_ifix.tar

The IBM advisories are available at:

Title: HP-UX ARPA Transport Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP-UX.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
No further details were provided.

Only systems running ARPA Transport are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following patch, available at:

ftp://ss071463:ss071463@hprc.external.hp.com/

 UNOF_37676.depot

MD5 sum = 2ede1ed39a35fd470dff88f023523f61 UNOF_37676.depot

The HP advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01328657

Title: FreeBSD pty May Disclose Information to Local Users
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in FreeBSD pty.  A local user can monitor a target user's pty.
If a local, non-root target user runs script(1) or other programs that use openpty(3), the pseudo-terminal is world readable and world writable.  A local user can obtain the text printed to the target user's terminal [CVE-2008-0217].

The ptsname(3) function does not properly validate device node names.  A local user can read the content of a target user's pty [CVE-2008-0216].  Only FreeBSD 6.0 and later is affected by the ptsname vulnerability.

John Baldwin reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can monitor a target non-root user's pty.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix and provided the following solution instructions [quoted]:

Perform one of the following:

1) Upgrade your vulnerable system to 5-STABLE, 6-STABLE, or
7.0-PRERELEASE, or to the RELENG_7_0, RELENG_6_3, RELENG_6_2,
RELENG_6_1, or RELENG_5_5 security branch dated after the correction
date.

2) To patch your present system:

The following patches have been verified to apply to FreeBSD 5.5, 6.1,
6.2, 6.3, and 7.0 systems.

a) Download the relevant patch from the location below, and verify the
detached PGP signature using your PGP utility.

[FreeBSD 5.5]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:01/pty5.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:01/pty5.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 6.x]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:01/pty6.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:01/pty6.patch.asc

[FreeBSD 7.0]
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:01/pty7.patch
# fetch http://security.FreeBSD.org/patches/SA-08:01/pty7.patch.asc

b) Execute the following commands as root:

# cd /usr/src
# patch < /path/to/patch

c) Recompile the operating system as described in
<URL: http://www.freebsd.org/handbook/makeworld.html> and reboot the
system.

The FreeBSD advisory is available at:

http://security.freebsd.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-08:01.pty.asc

Title: OpenBSD rtlabel_id2name() NULL Return Value Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenBSD.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
Return values from the rtlabel_id2name() function are not properly validated.  A local user can cause a NULL value to be returned by using the SIOCGIFRTLABEL ioctl on an interface with no route label assigned to trigger a kernel panic.

Only version 4.2 is affected.

Chris Cappuccio reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch, available at:

ftp://ftp.openbsd.org/pub/OpenBSD/patches/4.2/common/005_ifrtlabel.patch

The OpenBSD advisory is available at:

http://openbsd.org/errata42.html

Title: Solaris libdevinfo Access Control Flaw Lets Local Users Access Files to Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris libdevinfo.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke the libdevinfo(3LIB) library to gain access to files on the system, including system files.  This can be exploited to gain elevated privileges on the system.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 125251-02 or later

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 125252-02 or later

The Sun advisory is available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/search/document.do?assetkey=1-26-103165-1

Title: Solaris dotoprocs() Function Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Solaris.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can invoke the dotoprocs() function to trigger a system panic.
Impact': A local user can cause a kernel panic on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

SPARC Platform

x86 Platform

    * Solaris 10 with patch 127112-06 or later

The Sun advisory is available at:

The software does not pass a proper path name to the trustchk_block_write() function in ceratin cases.

The impact was not specified.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:

Title: HP Tru64 File-on-File Mounting File System Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP Tru64.  A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the File-on-File Mounting File System (FFM) to cause denial of service conditions.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
